title: Millennium Health’s Banks Cleared Over Ill-Fated Loan
sub_head: A bankruptcy trustee alleged that banks underwriting a loan for Millennium Health concealed information about an intensifying government probe
body:
A New York federal judge put an end to a long-running legal battle waged by a bankruptcy trustee for Millennium Health LLC’s lenders against banks that arranged a nearly $1.8 billion loan for the drug-testing business before its bankruptcy.
Marc Kirschner, the bankruptcy trustee appointed in Millennium’s chapter 11 case, had sued banks including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citigroup Inc. in 2017. Mr. Kirschner alleged that as underwriters for Millennium, the banks had hidden information about a pending government inquiry when they marketed the loan to investors in 2014.
